edu.ucla.sspace.clustering
Interface Cluster<T extends DoubleVector>

All Known Implementing Classes:
CentroidCluster, SynchronizedCluster
public interface Cluster<T extends DoubleVector>

An interface for representing a single cluster, which is composed of several data points. Each cluster is expected to always be capable of generating a centroid and a subset of vectors which were assigned to the cluster. The subset of assigned vectors may be empty. In addition, each cluster records the indentifier of every data point assigned to the cluster, allowing users the option of storing all potential Vectors when the Cluster itself may discard them and then performing additional operations on the vectors.

Author:
Keith Stevens

Method Summary
 void addVector(T vector, int id)
          Adds vector with id to this Cluster.
 T centroid()
          Returns an immutable view of the centroid for this Cluster.
 double compareWithVector(T vector)
          Returns the similarity between this Cluster and vector.
 BitSet dataPointIds()
          Returns the set of identifiers for all data points assigned to this cluster.
 List<T> dataPointValues()
          Returns the set of stored data points, if any, for this cluster.
 void merge(Cluster<T> other)
          Merges the other Cluster with this Cluster.
 int size()
          Returns the total number of points assigned to this Cluster.

dataPointIds

BitSet dataPointIds()
Returns the set of identifiers for all data points assigned to this cluster. TODO: Consider returning a set and let implementations return a wrapped BitSet, as in the graphical-update branch.

merge

void merge(Cluster<T> other)
Merges the other Cluster with this Cluster. This Cluster will absorb all data points from other and update the centroid and data point assignments as needed.

size

int size()
Returns the total number of points assigned to this Cluster.
